description.p: Your exposure to the leylines of the Elemental Planes has changed you, granting you the following benefits:

ul.li: Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn the alter self spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the conjuration or transmutation schools of magic. You can cast each of these spells without expending a spell slot. Once you cast either of these spells in this way, you can’t cast that spell in this way again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. The spells’ spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

sheet.description: You can cast this feat’s spells without a spell slot once. You can also cast these spells using spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Your spellcasting ability for these spells is {{elemental blood:ability}}.

description.p: Increase your Intelligence by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your Wisdom by 1, to a maximum of 20.
Increase your Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You are an able physician, allowing you to mend wounds quickly and get your allies back in the fight. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Skill Proficiency. You gain proficiency in the Medicine skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you add double your proficiency bonus to checks you make with it.

Battle Medic. As an action, you can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore 1d6 + your Intelligence or Wisdom Modifier hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to yours or the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice (whichever is higher.) The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest.
First Responder. When you use a healer’s kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains hit points equal to your Intelligence or Wisdom modifier.

Healing Rerolls. Whenever you roll a die to determine the number of hit points you restore with a spell, potion, or any other ability, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

sheet.description: You can spend one use of a healer's kit to tend to a creature and restore 1d6 + {{healer:bonus}} hit points to it, plus additional hit points equal to yours or the creature's maximum number of Hit Dice (whichever is higher.) The creature can't regain hit points from this feat again until it finishes a short or long rest. When you use a healer’s kit to stabilize a dying creature, that creature also regains {{healer:bonus}} hit points.

description.p: You are exacting by nature, and slow to trust the word of others. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: You gain proficiency in the Insight skill. If you are already proficient in the skill, you gain expertise instead.
You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Insight) score and have advantage on Insight checks to determine if creatures are lying.

When you make an Insight check, you can choose to learn what the creature's bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks is. You can use this ability a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. Once you have, you can't do so again until you finish a Long Rest.

description.p: You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Insight) score and have advantage on Insight checks to determine if creatures are lying.

sheet.description: You have a +5 bonus to your passive Wisdom (Insight) score and have advantage on Insight checks to determine if creatures are lying.

sheet.description: When you make an Insight check, you can choose to learn what the creature's bonus to Charisma (Deception) checks is.

description.p: You've learned to use the weight of your weapons effectively and have adapted to use large weapons one-handed.

ul.li: Guts Grip. You may wield a two-handed melee weapon in one hand, treating it as a one-handed weapon. If you do, reduce the damage die by one step. For example, a greatsword or greataxe wielded in one hand deals 1d10 damage.
Heavy Handed. The one- and two-handed damage die for versatile melee weapons you wield increases by 1 step. For example, a longsword deals 1d10 damage in one hand or 1d12 damage in two.

Versatility. You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with light melee weapons. You gain a +2 bonus to damage rolls with heavy melee weapons. For melee weapons that are neither heavy or light, increase the range you score a Critical Hit with them by 1.

Weightless Weapons. You can ignore the heavy quality on weapons you wield, or add the light quality to weapons without the heavy quality (no action required). You may wield heavy weapons without penalties if you are Small or smaller.

sheet.description: You may wield two-handed melee weapons in one hand, reducing their damage die by one step You may increase the damage die of versatile melee weapons by one step. Gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls with light melee weapons, a +2 bonus to damage rolls with heavy melee weapons, or increase the critical range of melee weapons that are neither heavy or light by 1. Can ignore the heavy quality on melee weapons, or add the light quality to all other melee weapons. Can wield heavy weapons without penalty if you are Small or smaller.

element.name: Natural Weapon Master
element.prerequisite: A natural weapon trait, such as a Bite or Claw attack

p.i: Prerequisite(s): A natural weapon trait, such as a Bite or Claw attack.

description.p: Your natural weapons are more powerful than most.

ul.li: Swift Claws. You can make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action.
Honed Muscles. The weapon damage die of your natural weapon increases by 1 step. For example, if your weapon deals 1d6 damage, it deals 1d8 instead.
Slayer's Eye. When making an Unarmed Strike, increase the range you score a Critical Hit by 1.

sheet.description: You can make one Unarmed Strike as a Bonus Action. The damage die and Critical Hit range of your Unarmed Strikes both increase by 1 step.

p.i: Prerequisite(s): Strength or Dexterity 13 or higher

description.p: You've developed the skills necessary to hold your own in close-quarters grappling. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Attack Advantage. You have advantage on attack rolls against a creature you are grappling.
Damage Rerolls. Whenever you roll a damage die for your Unarmed Strike, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.
Fast Wrestler. You do not need to spend extra movement when you move a creature grappled by you, provided the creature is your size or smaller.
Fighting Style. You gain the Unarmed Fighting Style. If you already have this fighting style, you may choose another available to the Fighter class.

sheet.description: You have advantage on attack rolls against creatures you are grappling, and do not need to spend extra movement when you move a creature grappled by you as long as it is your size or smaller. When you roll damage for an Unarmed Strike, you can reroll the die if it rolls a 1, and you must use the new roll.

description.p: You have steeled yourself against grave threats. When all hope is lost, you stand tall against the storm. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Shadow of the Colossus. You gain a +2 bonus to your Armor Class against creatures of CR greater than or equal to your level. You lose this benefit if you are Charmed or Frightened by the creature, or if you are Incapacitated.
Enrage. You have Advantage on attack rolls against a creature that has reduced one of your allies to 0 Hit Points in the last round.

Quick-Time Event. If a creature you can see within 60 feet takes a Legendary Action, you can use your Reaction to try to interrupt the effect. Choose an ability score you have saving throw proficiency with and make an ability check with it (DC equals 10 plus 3 for each action the Legendary Action expended). On a success, the Legendary Action has no effect, but the actions are still spent. Once this ability successfully negates a Legendary Action, you can't use it again until you finish a Short Rest.

sheet.description: If a creature you can see within 60 feet takes a Legendary Action, you can use your Reaction to try to interrupt the effect. Make a {{iron hero:ability score}} ability check (DC10+3 for each action the Legendary Action costs). On a success, the Legendary Action has no effect, but the actions are still spent. Once this ability successfully negates a Legendary Action, you can't use it again until you finish a Short Rest. Additionally, you always have +2 AC against creatures of CR{{level}} or greater, as long as you are not Charmed or Frightened by said creature, or Incapacitated. You have Advantage on attack rolls against a creature that has reduced one of your allies to 0 Hit Points since your last turn.

Ability Score Increase. Choose one ability in which you lack saving throw proficiency. Increase the chosen ability score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You can use your Channel Divinity to make your very presence a soothing balm. As a Magic Action, you can move up to your Speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this Action, you can restore a number of hit points to that creature equal to 2d6 + your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1 hit point). This increases to 3d6 at level 5, 4d6 at level 9, 5d6 at level 13, and 6d6 at level 17. A creature can receive this healing only once whenever you take this Action.

sheet.description: You can move up to your Speed, without provoking an opportunity attacks, and when you move within 5 feet of any other creature during this action, you can restore {{balm of peace:count}}d6+{{wisdom:modifier}} Hit Points to that creature (minimum of 1). A creature can receive this healing only once whenever you take this action.

description.p: You always have the Hunter's Mark spell prepared. You can cast it twice without expending a spell slot, and you regain one use of this ability when you finish a Short Rest, and all uses when you finish a Long Rest. Additionally, when you cast Hunter's Mark in this manner, you can choose to spend additional uses of this ability to increase the damage of the spell by 1d6 per use expended beyond the first.
The number of times you can cast the spell without a spell slot increases when you reach certain Ranger levels, as shown in the Favored Enemy column of the Ranger Features table.

sheet.description: You can cast Hunter's Mark spell without expending a spell slot. You can expend additional uses to increase the damage of your Hunter's Mark by 1d6 per use expended beyond the first. You regain one use of this ability when you finish a Short Rest.

description.p: Primal forces now help fuel you on your journeys, granting you the following benefits.

Temporary Hit Points. As a Magic action, you can give yourself a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d8 plus your Wisdom modifier (minimum of 1). You can use this action a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.
Decrease Exhaustion. Whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level, if any, decreases by 1.

sheet.description: You can give yourself a number of Temporary Hit Points equal to 2d8+{{tireless:thp}}. In addition, whenever you finish a Short Rest, your Exhaustion level decreases by 1.

description.p: You invoke spirits of nature to magically hide yourself. As a Bonus Action, you can give yourself the Invisible condition until the end of your next turn.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a Long Rest.

description.p: You are the child of a dragon and a mortal, or were transfigured into a half-dragon through rituals, boons, or exposure to the majesty of the mighty dragons. You gain the following traits:

ul.li: Draconic Ancestry. You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of damage from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and shape as well as your damage resistance are determined by dragons of that type, as shown in the table. Your ancestry does not necessarily determine your appearance.

Breath Weapon. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a shape determined by your Draconic Ancestry. Each creature in that area must make a saving throw (DC = 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) of a type determined by your Draconic Ancestry. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Draconic Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
Darkvision. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.

Draconic Resistance. You have resistance to the damage type associated with your Draconic Ancestry. If you choose poison, you have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the @condition[Poisoned] condition on yourself.
Dragonheart. Your creature type is dragon, rather than humanoid.

description.p: If you already have a Breath Weapon or Draconic Resistance trait (such as from the Dragonborn ancestry), work with your DM to find proper replacements. Common alternatives are options from the Draconic Legacy trait, the Half Dragon feat, or the Wyrm-Blessed Supernatural Gift.

description.p: The draconic influence which acts upon your essence grows stronger. Choose TWO of the following traits:

ul.li: Deep Breath. As an Action, you can take a deep breath and unleash your Breath Weapon in a more powerful manner. When you do, the damage increases to a number of d10s equal to half your Proficiency Bonus.
Dragon Wrath. Once per turn when you damage a creature with a weapon attack or spell, you can also deal 1d8 damage of a type associated with your Draconic Ancestry to that creature.
Wings. You have bat-like wings sprouting from your shoulder blades. You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

Visage. As a Bonus Action, you change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height between Medium and Small. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of an individual you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait. You stay in the new form until you use a Bonus Action to revert to your true form or until you die.

description.p: Instead of one of these traits, you may choose two of the following traits instead:

ul.li: Amphibious. You can breathe air and water, and you have a Swim Speed equal to your Speed.
Claws. Your claws are natural weapons with the Finesse property, which you can use to make unarmed strikes that deal Slashing damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
Desert Predator. You gain a Burrow Speed equal to half your Speed. You have Advantage on Saving Throws against effects from wind or sand.

Draconic Hide. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + Dexterity modifier. You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor.
Draconic Senses. You gain proficiency in the Perception skill. If you are already proficient in this skill, you gain Expertise instead.

Ice Walk. You gain a Burrow Speed equal to half your Speed. You can move around on icy surfaces without making ability checks. Difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn't cost you extra movement.
Rock Climber. You have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.

element.name: Dragon-Blooded: Soul of the First World

description.p: Your soul is connected to echoes of draconic might across time and space. You may choose a total of TWO traits selected from the Half Dragon feat, or from the following traits:

ul.li: Draconic Size. You are Large size, and your unarmed strikes deal an additional 1d6 damage of the same type. [Requires a natural weapon, such as a Bite or Claw attack]

Empowered Breath Weapon. If your breath weapon is a cone, it becomes 30 feet. If your breath weapon is a line, it extends to 60 feet. When you use your breath weapon with the Deep Breath trait, double its range. Additionally, you gain a second breath weapon. When you use your Breath Weapon trait, you can replace your breath weapon with an exhalation of energy in a 30-foot cone (60 feet if you use Deep Breath). Whenever you use this trait, choose:
Enervating Breath. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution Saving Throw or become Incapacitated until the start of your next turn.
Nightmare Breath. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Wisdom Saving Throw or become Frightened until the start of your next turn.
Repulsion Breath. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Strength Saving Throw or be pushed 20 feet away from you and be knocked Prone.

Sleep Breath. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution Saving Throw or fall Unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an Action to wake it.

Slowing Breath. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, the creature's Speed is halved, attack rolls against it have Advantage, it has Disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it cannot take Reactions until the end of your next turn.

Frightening Presence. Creatures of your choice that start their turns within 20 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw (DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Charisma modifier) or be Frightened of you until the start of its next turn. If the creature’s saving throw is successful, it is Immune to this ability for the next 24 hours.

Gemstone Telepathy. You can communicate telepathically to creatures within 60 feet of you. The contacted creature doesn't need to share a language with you to communicate in this way with it, but it must be able to understand at least one language.

Hybrid Draconic Ancestry. Choose two additional Draconic Ancestries. You have Resistance to the damage types associated with these Draconic Ancestries. Additionally, when you use your Breath Weapon, you may choose to use the Breath Weapons associated with those Draconic Ancestries.
Strong Wings. Your Fly Speed increases by 20 feet. [Requires the Wings trait, or an innate flying speed]

description.p: Your connection to Faerie is deeper than most. No matter what plane you reside on, the wild energy of the Feywild surges through you. You gain the following benefits:

ul.li: Fey Ancestry. You have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Charmed condition on yourself.

Fey Resistance. Choose one of the following damage types: Fire, Cold, Lightning, Poison, Psychic, or Thunder. You have Resistance to the chosen damage type. If you choose Poison, you have Advantage on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Poisoned condition on yourself.
Darkvision. You gain darkvision out to a range of 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by 30 feet.
Wild Soul. Your creature type is Fey, rather than Humanoid.

sheet.description: Your creature type is Fey. You have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Charmed condition, Resistance to {{fey resistance:type}} damage, and boosted Darkvision.

You have Resistance to Poison damage, and have Advantage on saving throws to avoid or end the Poisoned condition.
You have Resistance to Psychic damage.
You have Resistance to Thunder damage.
Your connections to the Feywild are so deep that you could easily pass as one of the Fair Folk, even to denizens of Faerie. Choose TWO of the following traits:

ul.li: Mark of the Dryad. You can communicate with beasts and plants as if you share a language. The starting attitude of beasts and plants is one step higher.

Mark of the Faun. Whenever you make a long or high jump, you can roll a d8 and add the number to the number of feet you cover, even when making a standing jump. This extra distance costs movement as normal. Additionally, you have horns that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, you deal 1d6 + your Strength modifier Piercing damage.

Mark of Glamour. You know the Disguise Self spell, and can cast it without expending a spell slot. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell when you cast it (choose when you select this ability).
Mark of the Naiad. If immersed in water, you can make yourself Invisible as a Bonus Action. You remain Invisible until you leave the water, end it with a Bonus Action, or die.
Mark of the Pixie. You have butterfly-like wings sprouting from your shoulder blades. You have a Fly Speed equal to your Speed.

Mark of Seasons. You become attuned to the primal magic of the seasons. Choose a season to associate yourself with: autumn, winter, spring, or summer. When finishing a Long Rest, you can change your season. As a bonus action, you can Fey Step, magically teleporting up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see and triggering an additional effect based on your current choice of season. If the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma modifier (choose when you select this trait). You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Autumn. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be Charmed by you for 1 minute, or until you or your companions deal any damage to the creatures.

Winter. When you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you before you teleport must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be Frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

Spring. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.
Summer. Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice that you can see within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
Mark of the Treetops. Your Speed increases by 10 feet, and you have a Climb Speed equal to your Speed.
